title: 103_hr429
content: The "Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act" designates amounts for the reduction of public debt under Subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes a new part titled "PART IX--DESIGNATION FOR REDUCTION OF PUBLIC DEBT" with section 6097 outlining the designation process. Every individual with adjusted income tax liability can designate up to 10 percent to reduce public debt when filing their tax return. The designation must be made on the first page or the page with the taxpayer's signature. Adjusted income tax liability refers to the income tax liability for the taxable year. The term 'adjusted income tax liability' refers to income tax liability reduced by any amount designated under section 6096 for the Presidential Election Campaign Fund. Part IX. Designation for reduction of public debt. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. PUBLIC DEBT REDUCTION TRUST FUND. Subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding a section for the Public Debt Reduction Trust Fund. The Public Debt Reduction Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States to pay off federal government obligations. Amounts designated for public debt reduction are appropriated to the Trust Fund for this purpose. The Public Debt Reduction Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States is used to pay off federal government obligations. Any obligation of the Federal Government included in the public debt can be redeemed or bought before maturity with amounts from the Trust Fund, and once paid, redeemed, or bought, it is canceled and retired and may not be reissued. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for the subchapter. The Public Debt Reduction Trust Fund is used to pay off federal government obligations. Amendments made by this section apply to amounts received after the enactment of this Act. Part C of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a new section for sequestration to reduce the public debt. Sequestration equivalent to estimated aggregate amount designated under section 6097 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall occur within 15 days after Congress adjourns, following any prior sequestration requirements. The legislation aims to reduce discretionary spending limits and net deficit changes from baseline amounts. Each account of the United States will be reduced by a calculated dollar amount based on the level of budgetary resources in that account. Each account of the United States will be reduced by a calculated dollar amount based on the level of budgetary resources in that account, with exemptions for certain accounts like Social Security benefits and net interest payments. The legislation aims to reduce discretionary spending limits and net deficit changes from baseline amounts by making reductions in specific accounts like the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the National Credit Union Administration. Additionally, Section 254 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended regarding reports. The Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a Department of Treasury report to Congress estimating income tax designated under the Internal Revenue Code. Sequestration to reduce the public debt is also added, along with new requirements for preview reports on estimates for the budget year. The Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a Department of Treasury report to Congress estimating income tax designated under the Internal Revenue Code. The preview reports shall set forth estimates for the budget year, including reductions required under section 253A and the sequestration percentage necessary for achieving the required reduction. The Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a Department of Treasury report to Congress estimating income tax designated under the Internal Revenue Code. The final reports will include all information from the public debt taxation designation report required on May 1. The effective date of the amendments made by this section will not be subject to the expiration date set forth in section 275(b) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. The amendments made by this section will expire after the first fiscal year without public debt.
